container.label: Container
container.name: Container Name

env.label: Environment Variables
env.description: In key-value pairs, separated by commas, e.g. KEY=VALUE,KEY2=VALUE2. Supports template variables

cmd.label: Startup Command
cmd.description: For example, bash -c "time" requires you to create three: bash, -c, time

port.label: Port Exposure
port.description: Port name is the name of the port you want to expose, which will be shown to participants. The port number is the service port inside the container. A1CTF will automatically map it to a random host port. Note! Different containers in the same challenge cannot expose the same port simultaneously! For example: if Container1 and Container2 both expose port 80, it will cause mapping issues! Please choose different listening ports when building the docker image.
port.name: Port Name
Please enter port name
port.min: Port number cannot be less than 1

container.empty: You haven't added any containers yet

wan.label: Allow External Network
wan.description: If disabled, the container cannot access the external network

dns.label: DNS Outbound
dns.description: This option only takes effect when external network access is disabled

attachment.label: Attachment
attachment.name: Attachment Name

upload.label: Upload
upload.failed: Auto save failed, please save manually

error.name: Attachment name must be at least 2 characters long
error.type: A valid attachment type must be selected

attachment.empty: You haven't added any attachments yet

name.label: Challenge Name
name.error: Challenge name must be at least 2 characters long

category.label: Challenge Category
category.error: A valid challenge category must be selected

judge.label: Judging Mode
judge.error: A valid judging mode must be selected

script.name: Script Match
script.label: Judging Script
script.description: If you choose dynamic judging, you must provide a judging script that meets the required format

flag.error: Flag must be at least 6 characters long
flag.label: Flag Type
flag.description: Please make sure to choose the correct flag type. In dynamic flag mode, the platform will use Leet to generate different but similar flags for each team. Avoid using overly short flags.
flag.info: Flags support template variables[team_hash] will be replaced with the team's unique identifier[team_name] will be replaced with the team name[game_id] will be replaced with the competition ID[uuid] will be replaced with a random UUID[random_string_??] will be replaced with a random string, where ?? indicates the lengthIf you choose Dynamic Flag in the challenge settings, Leet anti-cheat will be enabledTemplate variable parts will not be replaced by Leet
